definition:
a multipole variable that have physical
dimension and meaning.
opposite_reasoning: QualitativeAttribute provides the strongest semantic opposition for Fisher-LDA anchoring. MultipoleQuantity represents numerical, dimensional, measurable physical properties, while QualitativeAttribute represents non-numerical, descriptive properties. This quantitative↔qualitative opposition is fundamental in ontology and measurement theory, creating maximal semantic distance. The opposition is clear, philosophically grounded, and likely to produce well-separated concept clusters. It has higher confidence than dimensionless quantities (which are still quantitative) and better availability than nominal variables.
